tit.e: Yanagimoto Otsuka-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture)
Yanagimoto Otsuka-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 柳本大塚古墳（やなぎもとおおつかこふん）とは、奈良県天理市にある古墳である。
sen.e: The Yanagimoto Otsuka Kofun is a kofun (ancient tomb) located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
The Yanagimoto Otsuka-kofun Tumulus is an ancient tomb located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
The Yanagimoto Otsuka-kofun Tumulus is an ancient tomb located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
It belongs to the Yanagimoto Kofun Group.
It belongs to the Yanagimoto-kofun Tumuli Cluster.
It belongs to the Yanagimoto-kofun Tumuli Cluster.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 所在地：天理市柳本町大塚
sen.e: Location: Otsuka, Yanagimoto-cho,Tenri City
Location: Otsuka, Yanagimoto-cho,Tenri City
Location: Otsuka, Yanagimoto-cho,Tenri City
Burier: Unknown
sen.cmt: 埋葬者は被葬者のミスかも。その場合はBuried personとなりますが、原文通りにしております。
sen.e: Burier: Unknown
Buried person: Unknown
sen.cmt: Burier→Buried person埋葬者はこの場合、被葬者と判断しました。

sen.j: 築造時期：古墳時代前期前半。
sen.e: Time of construction: The First half of the early Kofun period.
Time of construction: The First half of the early Kofun period (Tumulus period).
Time of construction: The First half of the early Kofun period (Tumulus period).
Tomb shape: Zenpokoenfun (large keyhole-shaped tomb).
Tomb shape: A large keyhole-shaped mound.
Tomb shape: A large keyhole-shaped mound.

sen.j: 後円部正円形ではない。
sen.e: The back circular part is not precise circle shaped.
The back circular part is not precise circle shaped.
The back circular part is not precise circle shaped.

sen.j: 前方部の正面は弧状であるが、撥形のように広がってはおらずむしろすぼまっている。
sen.e: The front of the front part is an arch which gets narrower instead of extending like a plectrum.
The front of the front square part is an arch which gets narrower instead of extending like a plectrum.
The front of the front square part is an arch which gets narrower instead of extending like a plectrum.

sen.j: 周濠は墳丘西において未確認。
sen.e: A loop moat is unverified in the west tomb hill.
A surrounding moat is unverified in the west tomb hill.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: A surrounding moat is unverified in the west tomb hill.
Size: About 94m in total length.
Size: Approximately 94 meters in total length.
Size: Approximately 94 meters in total length.
The back circular part is 54m in diameter.
The back circular part is 54 meters in diameter.
The back circular part is 54 meters in diameter.

sen.j: 埋葬施設：主室は後円部墳丘中央部の南北主軸に沿う竪穴式石室（長さ約3.6メートル、幅約3.6メートル）、舟形の刳抜式木棺（長さ約2メートル、幅約1.2メートル）で同棺からは同鏃と鉄器が出土した。
sen.e: The burial facilities: The main chamber, a pit stone chamber (about 3.6m in length and about 3.6m in width) along the north-south axis in the center of the back circular part mound, and a hollowed-out wooden ship-shaped coffin (about 2m in length and about 1.2m in width), from which copper arrowheads and iron vessels were found.

The burial facilities: The main chamber, a pit stone chamber (approximately 3.6 meters in length and approximately 3.6 meters in width) along the north-south axis in the center of the back circular part mound, and a hollowed-out wooden ship-shaped coffin (approximately 2 meters in length and approximately 1.2 meters in width), from which copper arrowheads and iron vessels were found.

The burial facilities: The main chamber, a pit stone chamber (approximately 3.6 meters in length and approximately 3.6 meters in width) along the north-south axis in the center of the back circular part mound, and a hollowed-out wooden ship-shaped coffin (approximately 2 meters in length and approximately 1.2 meters in width), from which copper arrowheads and iron vessels were found.

sen.j: 直径1メートルの不正円形の小石室が設けられ、径39.7センチの大型仿製内行花文鏡が納められていた。
sen.e: A small irregular circle shaped stone chamber 1m in diameter was set up and a large bronze mirror (37.9cm in diameter) was placed.

A small irregular circle shaped stone chamber 1 meter in diameter was set up where Ogata bosei naiko kamon-kyo (a large bronze mirror manufactured in Japan with patterns like a flower-petal) with 39.7 centimeters in diameter was placed.
sen.cmt: 数字を修正し、表現を変えました。
sen.e: A small irregular circle shaped stone chamber 1 meter in diameter was set up where Ogata bosei naiko kamon-kyo (a large bronze mirror manufactured in Japan with patterns like a flower-petal) with 39.7 centimeters in diameter was placed.

sen.j: この小石室は、板石が天井の方にせり出した合掌式石室で副葬品埋納の副室と考えられている。
sen.e: This small stone chamber is a gassho-style stone chamber with flagstones jutting into the ceiling, which may have been a subsidiary chamber to put in grave goods.

This small stone chamber is a gassho-style (an architect method of beams combined to form a steep roof that resembles two hands together) stone chamber with flagstones jutting into the ceiling, which may have been a subsidiary chamber to put in grave goods.

This small stone chamber is a gassho-style (an architect method of beams combined to form a steep roof that resembles two hands together) stone chamber with flagstones jutting into the ceiling, which may have been a subsidiary chamber to put in grave goods.
Unearthed relics
Unearthed relics
Unearthed relics

sen.j: 大型内行花文鏡（鋼鏡・径39.7cm・宮内庁所蔵、四葉座間・連弧文間・雷雲文帯に配置された単位文様は渦巻き文のみ。）
sen.e: A large naikokamonkyo mirror (steel mirror/39.7cm in diameter, owned by the Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: 正確な読み方不明（四葉座間・連弧文間・雷雲文帯）
sen.e: Ogata naiko kamon-kyo (a large mirror with patterns like a flower-petal): Steel mirror, 39.7centimeters in diameter, owned by the Imperial Household Agency; only Uzumaki-mon pattern (a decorative spiral pattern) is used as the unit of pattern arranged in the spaces between Shiyoza (decorative pieces arranged like four leaves) pieces, Renko-mon (a decorative pattern with consecutive arcs arranged like a flower) pattern, and Raiun-mon (a decorative pattern with thunder cloud) zone.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「四葉座間・連弧文間・雷雲文帯に配置された単位文様は渦巻き文のみ。」を補足し、原文に「）」を補足しました。
sen.e: Ogata naiko kamon-kyo (a large mirror with patterns like a flower-petal): Steel mirror, 39.7centimeters in diameter, owned by the Imperial Household Agency; only Uzumaki-mon pattern (a decorative spiral pattern) is used as the unit of pattern arranged in the spaces between Shiyoza (decorative pieces arranged like four leaves) pieces, Renko-mon (a decorative pattern with consecutive arcs arranged like a flower) pattern, and Raiun-mon (a decorative pattern with thunder cloud) zone.

sen.j: （四葉座間・連弧文間の周囲は珠文を地の文の様に隙間なく埋められている。）
sen.e: The circuit of yotubazakan/renkozakann patterns are densely filled in with shumon patterns.
(Shiyoza Piece and Renko-mon Pattern are surrounded by Shumon [a raised bead] beads laid closely together as a pattern of the base.)
sen.cmt: 原文に「（」「）」を補足し、表現を変えました。
sen.e: (Shiyoza Piece and Renko-mon Pattern are surrounded by Shumon [a raised bead] beads laid closely together as a pattern of the base.)
Copper arrowhead (1) X 6
Six copper arrowhead
Six copper arrowhead
